1553213.content:
As you're propelled from your disgusting confines, you start to notice that your vision is filled with blue... and nothing but blue. Not a single color to break up the massive wall of blue beneath you. Out of everything that could ever happen to you, this was the absolute worst. The seagull must have flown out farther than you had thought, taking you out into the open ocean!

You mentally screamed as you fell with a splash into the water below. Luckily, you managed to hold together as your body soon started to reform, returning to your human shape, though your swim trunks didn't seem to make the trip with you. The second you were back to normal, you screamed and tried to swim for land, wherever that was. The splashing of water was the only sound you could hear over your crying. This was horrible. Here you were, helpless and out in the middle of the ocean, with no idea of where any land was, much less your mother. Tears ran down your face as you thought about her and you swam as hard as you could, trying to keep water from getting in your mouth.

After several hours of nonstop swimming, you were exhausted and you were soaking wet, with seaweed having clung onto your shoulders and legs. You turned on your back and simply lied on the water, inhaling a bit of air to keep you afloat.

=====================

You had been doing this for what seemed like forever. Swimming until you were tired, and bobbing on the surface of the ocean until you felt like you were ready to go again. You weren't sure exactly how long you were out here, but you were certain that it had been at least two days, as you noticed the sky go dark twice. You missed your mother. You missed Andrew. You even missed Ms. Morrison and Stevie, and your cousin, Kat. You want this bad dream to be over so you can go home and play your video games with your friend, eat some cupcakes made by your mom, and just give her a big hug.

Having become exhausted for the third time today, you think as you float there on the water. You didn't feel like you had gotten any closer to land, and you certainly hadn't seen any boats or planes go by. You had begun to question whether or not you would ever get home. Is this how it ends for you? Just floating on the ocean's surface for the rest of your life? You didn't like that idea one bit. You had to keep trying, no matter how long it took. You yawned as you lied there, not having gotten any sleep since you had gone on what you thought would be an enjoyable trip to the beach. You knew that if you fell asleep, any progress that you might have made could possibly be undone, but you couldn't stay awake forever. Tired and scared from your journey, you close your eyes, hoping that when you woke, you would be reunited with your loving mother.

What happens now?
1553213.title: Stranded at Sea

choices: You manage to sneak to the other side undetected.
15532132.content:
Your deep slumber is disturbed as your mouth is filled with the taste of sand. You sit up and spit the sand out of your mouth, coughing up bits of shells onto the beach. "*cough* *cough* Where... *cough* where am I?", you ask no one in particular. You stand up and brush the sand off your body, wrapping some of the seaweed that had washed up on the beach around your waist to cover your exposed groin as you examined your new surroundings. There didn't appear to be any people around that you could see, nor were there any animals. The only thing that caught your attention was a forest in the distance. "Maybe someone there can help me", you thought as you began to run over. However, after just a few steps, your leg folded in on itself and collapsed, causing you to fall face-first into the sand again. It had been almost three days since you had eaten anything, and your body was struggling to hold onto it's shape. While you didn't need to breathe like normal people, you still needed to eat. You remember your mother telling you that if you didn't get the proper nutrition, your body would forget it's shape. Living the rest of your existence as a living blob was the last thing you wanted. "Hope there's something to eat around here", you groan as you limp toward the forest.

It took you about five minutes to get to the forest's edge, and five more to get your foot unstuck from in between a couple of rocks. As you head deeper into the forest, you hear a tree branch snap. Something else is in here! Your body still weak, you limp as fast as you can away from the sound, hoping not to meet whatever caused it. In your current state, there's no way you would be able to last against a potential threat. After about half an hour of frantic limping, you trip and stumble into a pile of fruit!

"Food!", you cry out as you greedily stuff your face with fruit. It had been so long since you've eaten anything, you didn't question where the fruit came from, or why it was arranged in this way. All you knew was that you were starving and you needed something in your belly. As you munch on a large mango, you notice some voices coming from behind you. You look back and see several women and girls walking around some shelters made of grass and wood. The adults look rather well built, having a noticeable amount of muscle, and appear to be very tall (well, taller than you remember your mother being). The girls look to be pretty strong, too. In addition, they look to be barely dressed, clad in only grass skirts and little else. There didn't appear to be any men or boys around that you could see. If there were any around here, they must've been in another area.

It doesn't take you long to realize who's food you were eating. You gulp down the last of the mango you were munching on and slowly walk off, hoping to not grab the attention of these amazonian natives.

Are you able to escape undetected?

155332.content:
You opened your mouth to complain, but you were cut off by your mom shoving two tickets right in front of your face. You took a step back in surprise, and looked closely at the two tickets. Your eyes widened as you realized that they were movie tickets for the new film, “Ant Man”. You had been waiting to see Ant Man for months, and you couldn’t believe your mom had actually bought tickets for you and her to go.

“Oh my gosh mom!” You cried. “You’re the best!” You gave her a big hug, burying your face into her ample cleavage.

“You’re welcome Jackie.” She smiled, hugging you back. After a minute, she pulled you away from her cleavage. “Now come on, or we’ll be late!” The two of your ran outside to her car, and drove off to the movie theater.

The theater was much more packed than you expected it to be, with nearly all of the seats being filled up. You spotted two empty seats near the back of the theater, and you headed there. You sat down in one of the seats, realizing just how big the seats were compared to your small body.

Just then, the lights in the theater dimmed, and the advertisements began to play. The theater grew incredibly dark, and all of the audience quieted down to watch the movie. Your attention became laser focused on the movie screen. You were so focused that you didn’t notice the two teenaged girls walking right towards you.

info.brief_description: A boy with an unusual condition struggles to make it through the day. Will he survive?
info.description:
[author's update: Thank you to everyone who enjoyed this story, and continue to enjoy it. I'm glad everyone still loves Jack's tale after all these years. Because I've gotten so many requests for people to see it, I've decided to make it public again. However, I don't want to take away from the reboot, so I'm going to end all of the story branches where they are. If there are any storylines you would like to be moved over to the rebooted story, you're more than welcome to as long as you credit the original author of the chapter.

I hope you'll enjoy the new version of the story over here: https://www.writing.com/main/interactive-story/item_id/2202381-A-Squishy-Boy-reb... ]

You are nine year-old Jack Harper. You were born with a squishy, putty-like body. While this makes you practically immortal, it also means you're extremely weak, constantly getting squashed and flattened by almost everything. Things really started getting bad when you started school, after which your mother pulled you out the first chance she got. You seem to be able to take an awful lot of punishment. Getting smooshed doesn't really hurt you. In fact, you could be melted into a puddle and still be fine. You still hate it nonetheless. You're kind of a geek, often studying on the internet and playing video games. You're almost exactly three feet tall, black hair, and tan skin. You like wearing funny or "awesome" shirts, even though no one usually sees them. Being sheltered most of your life, you don't really know how normal people are supposed to act and often get yourself in trouble. You seem to have stopped aging.

Trish Harper - 41. Your mother. You and her are pretty close, especially after your father left. She's sort of cheap and a bit scatterbrained. She home schools you and often takes you to work with her. She's very attractive, though with a bit of extra weight in her rear. She's of average height with sandy blonde hair and lightly tanned skin.

Katrina "Kat" Harper - 13. Your tomboyish older cousin who lives in a rural area on the other side of town. You often go over to her house during the summer and help her and your aunt and uncle with their animals. You've had a pretty good relationship with her ever since you were very little. She seems to have a desire to toughen you up, often allowing you to do things that would normally make your mother freak out.

Andrew Morrison - 8. An annoying, but friendly neighbor boy. He's been your best friend since your mother pulled you out of school. His mother doesn't pay much attention to him, so your mom has taken it upon herself to make him your unofficial brother. He often teases you, but he knows where to draw the line (sometimes). He knows about your condition and tries to help your mom out, sometimes too much.

Barbara Morrison - 40. Andrew's neglectful mother and an old friend of Trish's. While she's very attractive, going through great lengths to maintain her body, she's also not very nice to you. She hasn't put you in danger herself (yet) but she goes out of her way to mock you when she find you in these situations.

Stephan "Stevie" Morrison - 4. Andrew's little brother. Stevie's kind of a brat. While Barbara pays little attention to Andrew, she practically spoils Stevie. (The relationship between Jack, Andrew, and Stevie may change depending on the storyline.)

Ashley "Ash" Parker - 15. Andrew's cousin. You had a pretty horrible encounter with him one Halloween, but he made things right soon after. He seems pretty cool to you, but you still aren't sure of what to think of him. He often babysits his cousins.

Kentwolf created a followup story following up on these characters five years later here: http://www.writing.com/main/interact/item_id/1975029-A-Squishy-Teen
If you like this story, you should check out their stuff.
